{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3536269,"name":"Mert Ata BABER","username":"BABER","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/baber/{size}/173331_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T13:06:47.747Z","cooked":"

Hi, while trying to connect to one of our Rio 2, it does not connect to DS via both radios. I have tried with both old radio and new radio.
To see if radio setup works I tried swapping just the roborio with another roborio 2 and it connected perfectly fine.
Rio we are experiencing the issue works fine when connected via usb.
Power is solid green and rsl is solid on the faulty roborio.
Team number setter see the faulty one when I connect to radio as in the screenshot but driver station does not.

image797×551 23.9 KB

TL;DR: 1 one our Roborio works fine while other one does not work with the same setup when connecting viao radio to DS. Faulty Roborio connects fine via usb. Screenshot above shows faulty roborio connected via radio.

Set the team number for the Rio. You can use either the rio imaging tool or the team number setting tool to do so

It is already set and faulty rio connects to DS fine when connected with usb.

From your screenshot, it’s definitely not set properly. The hostname should show as roborio-<team#>-frc.local.

Connecting successfully over USB is expected since it doesn’t rely on team number.

I have tried setting it with both imaging tool and team number setter tool. If I am not wrong pressing the “set team to 8795” on team number setter tool or writing the team number and pressing apply on imaging tool should do it right? Nothing changes on the team number setter tool screen. I will try to re-image the sd card and set it again.
EDIT: Re-imaging and resetting the number worked. Thank you.
